intro: Bossiaea calcicola, commonly known as the limestone bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. The plant thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is known for its ability to withstand arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
